void MIDICTRL_Cmd ( HT_SPI_TypeDef *  QSPIx,
ControlStatus  NewState 
)

Enable or Disable QSPI MIDICTRL.

Parameters:
QSPIx,:where QSPIx is the selected QSPI from the QSPI peripherals.
NewState,:This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
Return values:
None

Definition at line 162 of file ht32f5xxxx_spi_midi.c.

void SPI_ClearFlag ( HT_SPI_TypeDef *  SPIx,
u32  SPI_Flag 
)

Clear the specified SPI flag.

Parameters:
SPIx,:where SPIx is the selected SPI from the SPI peripherals.
SPI_Flag,:specify the flag that is to be cleared. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • SPI_FLAG_WC : SPI write collision flag
  • SPI_FLAG_RO : SPI read overrun flag
  • SPI_FLAG_MF : SPI mode fault flag
  • SPI_FLAG_SA : SPI slave abort flag
  • SPI_FLAG_TOUT : SPI time out flag
Return values:
None

u32  SPI_FIFODirection 
)

Parameters:
SPIx,:where SPIx is the selected SPI from the SPI peripherals.
SPI_FIFODirection,:specify the FIFO that is to be checked. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • SPI_FIFO_TX :
  • SPI_FIFO_RX :
Return values:
Thenumber of data in Tx FIFO or Rx FIFO.

Definition at line 495 of file ht32f5xxxx_spi.c.

FlagStatus SPI_GetFlagStatus ( HT_SPI_TypeDef *  SPIx,
u32  SPI_Flag 
)

Check whether the specified SPI flag has been set or not.

Parameters:
SPIx,:where SPIx is the selected SPI from the SPI peripherals.
SPI_Flag,:specify the flag that is to be check. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • SPI_FLAG_TXBE : SPI Tx buffer empty flag
  • SPI_FLAG_TXE : SPI Tx empty flag
  • SPI_FLAG_RXBNE : SPI Rx buffer not empty flag
  • SPI_FLAG_WC : SPI write collision flag
  • SPI_FLAG_RO : SPI read overrun flag
  • SPI_FLAG_MF : SPI mode fault flag
  • SPI_FLAG_SA : SPI slave abort flag
  • SPI_FLAG_TOUT : SPI time out flag
  • SPI_FLAG_BUSY : SPI busy flag
Return values:
SETor RESET

Definition at line 661 of file ht32f5xxxx_spi.c.

void SPI_GUARDTConfig ( HT_SPI_TypeDef *  SPIx,
u32  Guard_Time 
)

Set the SPIx guard time length.

Parameters:
SPIx,:where SPIx is the selected SPI from the SPI peripherals.
Guard_Time,:number of SCK to be the guard time length. This parameter can be: SPI_GUADTIME_1_SCK to SPI_GUADTIME_16_SCK.
Return values:
None

Definition at line 138 of file ht32f5xxxx_spi.c.

void SPI_IntConfig ( HT_SPI_TypeDef *  SPIx,
u32  SPI_Int,
ControlStatus  NewState 
)

Enable or Disable the specified SPI interrupt.

Parameters:
SPIx,:where SPIx is the selected SPI from the SPI peripherals.
SPI_Int,:specify if the SPI interrupt source to be enabled or disabled. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
  • SPI_INT_TXBE : SPI Tx buffer empty interrupt
  • SPI_INT_TXE : SPI Tx empty interrupt
  • SPI_INT_RXBNE : SPI Rx buffer not empty interrupt
  • SPI_INT_WC : SPI write collision interrupt
  • SPI_INT_RO : SPI read overrun interrupt
  • SPI_INT_MF : SPI mode fault interrupt
  • SPI_INT_SA : SPI slave abort interrupt
  • SPI_INT_TO : SPI time out interrupt
  • SPI_INT_ALL : All SPI interrupt
NewState,:This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
Return values:
None

Definition at line 430 of file ht32f5xxxx_spi.c.

void SPI_PDMACmd ( HT_SPI_TypeDef *  SPIx,
u32  SPI_PDMAREQ,
ControlStatus  NewState 
)

Enable or Disable the SPIx PDMA interface.

Parameters:
SPIx,:where SPIx is the selected SPI from the SPI peripherals.
SPI_PDMAREQ,:specify the SPI PDMA transfer request to be enabled or disabled. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
  • SPI_PDMAREQ_TX : Tx PDMA transfer request
  • SPI_PDMAREQ_RX : Rx PDMA transfer request
NewState,:This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
Return values:
None

void SPI_SELHTConfig ( HT_SPI_TypeDef *  SPIx,
u32  CS_Hold_Time 
)

Set the SPIx chip select hold time.

Parameters:
SPIx,:where SPIx is the selected SPI from the SPI peripherals.
CS_Hold_Time,:number of SCK to be the hold time length. This parameter can be: 0 ~ 15
Return values:
None

Definition at line 693 of file ht32f5xxxx_spi.c.

void SPI_SELModeConfig ( HT_SPI_TypeDef *  SPIx,
u32  SPI_SEL 
)

SEL pin is configured to be driven by hardware or software.

Parameters:
SPIx,:where SPIx is the selected SPI from the SPI peripherals.
SPI_SEL,:specify the SPI SEL pin mode. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • SPI_SEL_HARDWARE : SEL is driven by hardware
  • SPI_SEL_SOFTWARE : SEL is driven by software
Return values:
None

Definition at line 405 of file ht32f5xxxx_spi.c.

void SPI_SoftwareSELCmd ( HT_SPI_TypeDef *  SPIx,
u32  SPI_SoftwareSEL 
)

Configure the SEL state by software.

Parameters:
SPIx,:where SPIx is the selected SPI from the SPI peripherals.
SPI_SoftwareSEL,:specify if the SPI SEL to be active or inactive. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • SPI_SEL_ACTIVE : activate SEL signal
  • SPI_SEL_INACTIVE : deactivate SEL signal
Return values:
None
